notes_theoryTitle: This theory proposes that consciousness corresponds to integrated information in the brain.
notes_category: A major theory in contemporary philosophy of mind and cognitive science.
summary: IIT proposes that consciousness corresponds to integrated information (Φ) in a system. The more integrated information a system has, the more conscious it is.
notes_summary: This is a mathematical approach to consciousness that provides a quantitative measure.

overview.purpose: To provide a scientific theory of consciousness that can be measured and tested
overview.notes_purpose: IIT aims to bridge the gap between subjective experience and objective measurement.
overview.focus: The relationship between information integration and conscious experience
overview.notes_focus: Focuses on how information is processed and integrated in neural networks.
overview.approach: Mathematical and computational modeling of information integration
overview.notes_approach: Uses complex mathematical formulas to quantify consciousness.

components.ontologicalStatus: Consciousness is a fundamental property of integrated information systems
components.notes_ontologicalStatus: IIT treats consciousness as a real, measurable phenomenon.
components.explanatoryIdentity: Consciousness IS integrated information, not just correlated with it
components.notes_explanatoryIdentity: This is an identity theory, not just a correlation.

functionAndEvolution.function: To integrate information from different sources into a unified experience
functionAndEvolution.notes_function: Consciousness serves to create a coherent model of the world.
functionAndEvolution.evolution: Evolved to provide adaptive advantages through integrated information processing
functionAndEvolution.notes_evolution: Consciousness may have evolved because it provides survival advantages.

components.notes_causation: The integration process itself generates the conscious state.
components.location: Present wherever there is sufficient integrated information
components.notes_location: Not limited to brains - could exist in other complex systems.

arguments.notes_id: The Φ measure provides a quantitative way to assess consciousness
arguments.description: IIT provides a mathematical measure (Φ) for consciousness that can be calculated for any system
arguments.notes_description: This allows for objective measurement of consciousness.
arguments.notes_tags: These tags highlight the scientific nature of the approach.
arguments.notes_clarity_rationality: The mathematical framework makes predictions that can be empirically tested.
arguments.notes_philosophical_tensions: Raises questions about machine consciousness and the hard problem.

arguments.notes_id: Focuses on how information is integrated rather than just processed
arguments.description: Consciousness requires not just information processing, but integration of that information
arguments.notes_description: This distinguishes conscious from unconscious processing.
arguments.notes_tags: Emphasizes the unified nature of conscious experience.
arguments.clarity_rationality: Medium - integration is hard to define precisely
arguments.notes_clarity_rationality: While intuitive, the exact nature of integration needs clarification.
arguments.notes_philosophical_tensions: Addresses the binding problem but may not fully solve it.

components.notes_arguments: These arguments form the core of IIT's theoretical foundation.

bigQuestions.what_is_consciousness: What is the nature of conscious experience?
bigQuestions.notes_what_is_consciousness: IIT provides a specific answer: consciousness is integrated information.
bigQuestions.how_does_it_arise: How does consciousness arise from physical processes?
bigQuestions.notes_how_does_it_arise: Through the integration of information in complex systems.
bigQuestions.notes_can_machines_be_conscious: IIT suggests yes, if they have sufficient integrated information.
bigQuestions.measurement_problem: How can we measure consciousness objectively?
bigQuestions.notes_measurement_problem: Through the Φ measure of integrated information.

philosophicalFocus.mind_body_problem: Addresses the mind-body problem through information integration
philosophicalFocus.notes_mind_body_problem: Provides a bridge between physical and mental properties.
philosophicalFocus.hard_problem: Attempts to solve the hard problem of consciousness
philosophicalFocus.notes_hard_problem: By identifying consciousness with integrated information.
philosophicalFocus.qualia: Explains the nature of qualitative experience
philosophicalFocus.notes_qualia: Through the specific way information is integrated in each system.
philosophicalFocus.free_will: Implications for free will and agency
philosophicalFocus.notes_free_will: Consciousness as integrated information may support certain forms of agency.

kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.paradigm: Information integration as the fundamental principle of consciousness
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.notes_paradigm: This represents a new paradigm in consciousness studies.
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.normal_science: Developing better measures of Φ and testing predictions
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.notes_normal_science: Current research focuses on refining the mathematical framework.
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.anomalies: Cases where high Φ doesn't correlate with expected consciousness
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.notes_anomalies: Some systems may have high integration but limited consciousness.
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.crisis: Challenges to the universality of the Φ measure
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.notes_crisis: Questions about whether Φ captures all aspects of consciousness.
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.revolution: Potential shift from correlation to identity theories of consciousness
kuhnFrameworkForAnalysis.notes_revolution: IIT represents a revolutionary approach to understanding consciousness.
